block.p: Universal Studios, owned by Vivendi Universal, said yesterday that it had begun a review for its theme-park advertising account, with billings estimated at $30 million to $40 million.

''We want to take our future marketing to a whole new level with some bold goals and new partners,'' said Jim Canfield, a spokesman for Universal, confirming a report of the review this week in Adweek.
Universal Studios, owned by Vivendi Universal, said yesterday that it had begun a review for its theme-park advertising account, with billings estimated at $30 million to $40 million.

''We want to take our future marketing to a whole new level with some bold goals and new partners,'' said Jim Canfield, a spokesman for Universal, confirming a report of the review this week in Adweek.

Mr. Canfield declined to say whether the incumbent agency of more than three years -- Messner Vetere Berger McNamee Schmetterer Euro RSCG in New York, part of the Euro RSCG Worldwide unit of Havas Advertising -- would be invited to take part in the review. He declined to identify any of the agencies being asked to participate.
The assignment includes campaigns for Universal Studios Hollywood in California and Universal Orlando in Florida. A decision is expected by the end of the summer.
